list_definition.definition: to inform or give information to (a person) about (something)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He told the whole story to John

list_definition.definition: to order or command; to suggest or warn

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I told him to go away.

list_definition.definition: to say or express in words

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He wants to tell us a story.

list_definition.definition: to distinguish; to see (a difference); to know or decide

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Can you tell the difference between them?
I can’t tell one from the other
You can tell if the meat is cooked by/from the colour.
You mustn’t tell or we’ll get into trouble.

list_definition.definition: to be effective; to be seen to give (good) results

list_ex_of_english: All are concerned with telling the story of her life.
The history of the relationship between insurance and civil society, as usually told, is an anticlimactic narrative.
You told him that you would help him with writing.
A telling example-of importance for the study reported below-involves (thematic) verb raising.
A doctor told him that this condition was caused by excess consumption of roasted and fried food.
We were told that it was part of our remit to produce a solution to this problem.
The child tells her imaginary baby two stories of empire, in quick succession.
They were told to read and make the decision as quickly and accurately as possible.
